Define Documentation

#define HT_DECODE_BYTES32 ( _ip_,
_r_,
_out_,
_len_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  uint32_t _tmp_; \
  HT_DECODE_I32(_ip_, _r_, _tmp_); \
  HT_DECODE_NEED(_r_, _tmp_); \
  _out_ = (uint8_t *)(_ip_); \
  _r_ -= _tmp_; \
  _ip_ += _tmp_; \
  _len_ = _tmp_; \
} while (0)
Decode bytes32 (i32, data).

Parameters:
_ip_ - input buffer pointer
_r_ - varable with remaining bytes
_out_ - variable for output
_len_ - variable for result length

    HT_DECODE_NEED(_r_, 4); \
    _v_ = *(_ip_)++; \

    _v_ |= (*(_ip_)++ << 16); \
    _v_ |= (*(_ip_)++ << 24); \

Definition at line 175 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_DECODE_I64 ( _ip_,
_r_,
_v_   ) 

Value:

do { \
    HT_DECODE_NEED(_r_, 8); \
    _v_ = *(_ip_)++; \
    _v_ |= (*(_ip_)++ << 8); \
    _v_ |= (*(_ip_)++ << 16); \
    _v_ |= ((uint64_t)(*(_ip_)++) << 24); \
    _v_ |= ((uint64_t)(*(_ip_)++) << 32); \
    _v_ |= ((uint64_t)(*(_ip_)++) << 40); \
    _v_ |= ((uint64_t)(*(_ip_)++) << 48); \
    _v_ |= ((uint64_t)(*(_ip_)++) << 56); \
  } while (0)
Decode a 64-bit integer encoded in little endian format.

Definition at line 110 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_DECODE_NEED ( _r_,
_l_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  if (_r_ < _l_) \
    HT_THROW_INPUT_OVERRUN(_r_, _l_); \
  _r_ -= _l_; \
} while (0)

_r_,
_s_,
_len_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  HT_DECODE_I16(_ip_, _r_, _len_); \
  _s_ = (char *)(_ip_); \
  _r_ -= (size_t)(_len_) + 1; \
  _ip_ += (size_t)(_len_) + 1; \
} while (0)

Definition at line 330 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_DECODE_VINT_ ( _type_,
_v_,
_ip_,
_r_,
_done_   ) 

Value:

_shift_ += 7; \
  if ((_ip_)[-1] & 0x80) { \
    HT_DECODE_NEED(_r_, 1); \
    _v_ |= ((_type_)(*(_ip_)++ & 0x7f) << _shift_); \
  } else _done_;

Definition at line 323 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_DECODE_VSTR ( _ip_,
_r_,
_out_,
_len_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  uint64_t _tmp_; \
  HT_DECODE_VI64(_ip_, _r_, _tmp_, break); \
  if (_tmp_ > (uint64_t)(SIZE_MAX)) \
    HT_THROW_BAD_VSTR("long vstr on 32-bit platform"); \
  _out_ = (char *)(_ip_); \
  _len_ = _tmp_++; \
  HT_DECODE_NEED(_r_, _tmp_); \
  _ip_ += _tmp_; \
  if ((_ip_)[-1]) /* should be null */ \
    HT_THROW_BAD_VSTR("vstr"); \
} while (0)
Decode a vstr (vint, data, null).

Definition at line 105 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_ENCODE_STR16 ( _op_,
_s_,
_len_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  uint16_t _s16tmp_ = _len_; /* just to be cautious */ \
  HT_ENCODE_I16(_op_, _s16tmp_); /* length */ \
  if (_s16tmp_ > 0) { \
    memcpy(_op_, _s_, _s16tmp_); /* data */ \
    _op_ += len; \
  } \
  *(*bufp)++ = 0; /* null */ \
} while (0)
Encode a string buffer in str16 format (i16, data, null).

Parameters:
_op_ - output buffer pointer
_s_ - input buffer pointer
_len_ - input buffer length

#define HT_ENCODE_VI32 ( _op_,
_v_,
_done_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  uint32_t _evtmp32_ = _v_; /* make sure these var names are not the same */ \
  HT_ENCODE_VINT0(_op_, _evtmp32_, _done_) \
  HT_ENCODE_VINT4(_op_, _evtmp32_, _done_) \
  HT_ENCODE_VINT_(_op_, _evtmp32_, _done_) \
  HT_THROW_UNPOSSIBLE("reach here encoding vint32"); \
} while (0)
Encode a 32-bit integer in vint format.

_done_ - return or break

#define HT_ENCODE_VSTR ( _op_,
_s_,
_len_   ) 

Value:

do { \
  size_t _vs64tmp_ = _len_; /* ditto */ \
  HT_ENCODE_VI64(_op_, _vs64tmp_, break); \
  if (_vs64tmp_) { \
    memcpy((_op_), _s_, _vs64tmp_); \
    (_op_) += _vs64tmp_; \
  } \
  *(_op_)++ = 0; \
} while (0)

Definition at line 440 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_ENCODED_LEN_VI32 ( _v_   ) 

Value:

(_v_ <= HT_MAX_V1B ? 1 : \
   (_v_ <= HT_MAX_V2B ? 2 : \
    (_v_ <= HT_MAX_V3B ? 3 : \
     (_v_ <= HT_MAX_V4B ? 4 : 5))))
vint encoded length of a 32-bit integer

Definition at line 247 of file serialization-c.h.

#define HT_ENCODED_LEN_VI64 ( _v_   ) 

Value:

(val <= HT_MAX_V1B ? 1 : \
   (val <= HT_MAX_V2B ? 2 : \
    (val <= HT_MAX_V3B ? 3 : \
     (val <= HT_MAX_V4B ? 4 : \
      (val <= HT_MAX_V5B ? 5 : \
       (val <= HT_MAX_V6B ? 6 : \
        (val <= HT_MAX_V7B ? 7 : \
         (val <= HT_MAX_V8B ? 8 : \
          (val <= HT_MAX_V9B ? 9 : 10)))))))))
vint encoded length of a 64-bit integer
